text:
Hey for everyone who has been working from home because of the pandemic, what has your experience been like? Some things that I do already is to keep a relatively consistent sleep schedule, getting around and doing chores/dressed nicely, go for a daily walk, take breaks (via pomodoro), and have a desk that is easy to shift between sitting and standing.

 Do you have any tips? I am starting a job soon where I will be working from home 9a - 5p daily. Any advice or articles you would suggest?

text: I have found benefit from an ergonomic keyboard and a clear monitor larger than my laptop screen (used as a second screen, so I can see references while designing software).  Eating a reasonably healthful breakfast and lunch and staying hydrated helps, too,

text: I have two desks, one for uni/productive work, one for everything else. Was a coincidence that I happened to have two desks available but I found it really useful to keep some separation between contexts. You can do the same with just one, too, e.g. if you can maybe sit on different sides of it

Then, when I am done working, shut down that computer and switch to my personal computer for anything else... Maybe?

text:
Ive had 8 months working from home so far! I got sick of my house and suburb after a while, especially during the worst lockdown, but got a lot of code written. We didnt really work week days 9-5 in the end, things drifted late and over weekends because there was nothing to distingush them. Its good to have some boundaries for that. 

We eradicated it, but we're all still working from home, or wherever we like now, a lot of people will literally never go back to regular office hours. 

Its good if you can take a laptop outside sometimes for a change of scene.
